hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 7 and height labeled 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ee436232b6d8a0de89c4c1dcf896241429d0acc3)

The rectangle has $\tealE{5}$ rows with $\goldE{7}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each row:

$\underbrace{\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}}_{\tealE{5}\text{ rows}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}+\goldE{7}=\tealE{5} \times \goldE{7}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $7+7+7+7+7$
- $5 \times 7$

question.content:
![a square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/42c6fe5b47f30e29c37a11d0e138167765042175) is $1$ unit square.

![a rectangle 7 squares wide and 5 squares high.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/736653cd974e8581b7c6d56611d047851c4711dc)

**Which expressions can we use to find the area of the rectangle?**
